website_summaries.verdict: If you're very picky about photo quality and prefer autofocus to manual -- but don't care about a viewfinder -- the Nikon Coolpix A is probably worth the money. Otherwise, wait for the price to drop.
pros: The Nikon Coolpix A produces the excellent photos you'd expect from a large sensor, and the camera is well built with a streamlined, if somewhat point-and-shoot-like, design
cons: For the price, it needs to deliver a little more, such as a viewfinder
aspects of its performance could be better

website_summaries.verdict: The Nikon Coolpix A is a dedicated wide-angle camera with a big image sensor. Image quality can suffer at the edges of the frame, and the autofocus is a bit slow, but if if you want to pack a lot into your shots, it's worth a look.
cons: Soft edges at f/2.8 and f/4
Movie setting is buried in menus

customer_reviews.title: Great bargain
customer_reviews.text: This is a great camera particularly for the big DX sensor. It has a solid, well made feel to it. The price has come down considerably from the original $1200 - so it's quite a bargain. Some folks have complained that it doesn't have a zoom lens, but it is aimed at street photography or very high quality snap shots.
customer_reviews.author: Cato

customer_reviews.title: Great camera. I love the viewfinder
customer_reviews.text: Great camera. I love the viewfinder. I have Parkinson's Disease, a movement disorder. When I try to take a picture with a digital camera, my arms are outstretched into that ridiculous pose that you are naturally forced into when watching the view screen on the back of the digital camera, My arms immediately start waving around, and every picture is blurry, But, with my Coolpix A, I just put my viewfinder lens in the flash holder, and I can scrintch myself against a prop, like a tree or a post, or a wall, whatever, and I get a nice, un-blurry picture with good exposure. Got mine at Amazon for $439. Great price.
customer_reviews.author: Jefe de Jefes

customer_reviews.title: As old as it is there is still no better compact camera out that takes good pictures in lowlight ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera a year ago.I was at a concert last night and got to drunk and must have dropped it or someone snagged it from me.As old as it is there is still no better compact camera out that takes good pictures in lowlight that I know of like this one.I just bought another one.I dont know why they dont have a camera like this that also shoots in 4K.I have to bring my Sony RX100V for the video.
customer_reviews.author: Michael R. Wojtasik

customer_reviews.title: as good as dslr
customer_reviews.text: Compact and powerful camera. This camera is small enough and You can carry it everywhere. When you see the moment you can capture it. Built quality: very solid. Response time: quick as dslr. Image quality: as good as dslr
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Best Camera Ever
customer_reviews.text: I love my CPA. Best camera Nikon ever made. Colors are brilliant!
customer_reviews.author: JC in Texas

customer_reviews.title: This is my go to camera for snapshots due to its lightness but excellent picture quality
customer_reviews.text: Been using this as my back up travel camera. This is my go to camera for snapshots due to its lightness but excellent picture quality. I am using an optical viewfinder and tone down the lcd which is nearly turned off. You can not turn it off completely but its just ok for using the optical viewfinder. The flash is not as powerful as X100 (last x camera i used) which can balance the ambient light in any lighting conditions. So i'm using my old sb-400 flash which is very powerful compared to the built in flash.
customer_reviews.author: Turquoi5eBlue

customer_reviews.title: Nikon COOLPIX A
customer_reviews.text: Bought it just as it got discontinued for ~$400. For this price it is a great buy, MSRP $1100, decent output to iso 3200, and has in camera raw processing, and flush syncs to 1/2000(from memory). But of course has not zoom, and not as compact as I would like it to be, need a pouch or a purse to carry it.
customer_reviews.author: SeeAndSay

customer_reviews.title: So very sharp and so many features.
customer_reviews.text: This camera has a large number of features - special settings, P, S, A modes and complete manual. you can even correct perspective in its editing menu
customer_reviews.author: John R. Aldridge

customer_reviews.title: Best camera you've never heard of.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this one for my wife who is a pro who shoots with Nikon. Lots of great things about this camera, but on of the best is that it uses the same exact menus as other Nikon DSLR's, which makes it much easier to use for someone who is used to using a more full feature camera.
customer_reviews.author: Roman Kilun

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Camera!!! Great Value!!!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent point and shoot camera. Initial price offering was way too high for it's class. Takes an excellent photograph. It handles like a DSLR. Well made. . . extremely fast handling. It goes with me just about everywhere I go. . . . bgs.
customer_reviews.author: Bob GlickSmith

customer_reviews.title: Great quality for the price
customer_reviews.text: First impressions are that I will miss an articulating screen and I am glad I bought one of the optical viewfinders the LCD has been impossible to use in bright sun due to the glare. The color of the jpg conversion and sharp focusing at F2.8 is a winner for such a small camera. I don't plan on going back to a smaller sensor now. I applaud Nikon aligning the A's button layout and menu system with their DSLRs. Same high build quality as the Coolpix P7100 had.
customer_reviews.author: Denny Flowers

customer_reviews.title: Great camera.
customer_reviews.text: Great camera, very sharpness and high quality pictures. I'm DSLR user and the Coolpix A also produce very high quality images with its great DX sensor and prime lens. Very portable, friendly menu and intuitive controls. I really like the user's setup, U1 and U2, when you can setup the parameters like maximum ISO, speed and aperture and make more fast the shooting in special conditions. Maybe its cost could be questionable, but I believe it is fair for the quality offered. It's not a camera for everyone, but it's a great option if you want a high end image and when you don't like or you don't need to carry a DSLR...
customer_reviews.author: Ricardo Toledo

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: great for static images but poor autofocus in low light or moving subjects.
customer_reviews.author: Gordon K. Leung

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, but fixed focal length.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent quality but could not get used to the fixed focal length idea. Purchased as a gift and fine for the right person.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory M.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Nice camera, delivered in excellent condition. Just not the right camera for our needs. No zoom lens.
customer_reviews.author: DC

customer_reviews.title: The camera stopped working in about 5 months. CPS ...
customer_reviews.text: The camera stopped working in about 5 months. CPS Central declined to honor warranty saying liquid damage. I can see No liquid damage.
customer_reviews.author: AB

customer_reviews.title: Very Good
customer_reviews.text: Pros: DSLR quality and features in a compact (pocketable) camera. Cons: Fixed lens, no viewfinder and contrast detection autofocus only.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great little Camera!
customer_reviews.text: Nikon Coolpix A fits perfectly with my style of shooting, as well as in my jeans back pocket! Amazing IQ!!
customer_reviews.author: O. Nedkov

customer_reviews.title: Great compact camera!
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing product, which produces high quality photos. As someone who is not a professional, I'm pleased that the gadgetry and settings of it haven't been all too difficult to figure out. The only thing I have mixed feelings about is not having the ability to zoom in and out. However, the camera's fixed lens has really pushed me to become more intimate with what I'm shooting though. I love how quickly it focuses and the clear photo shots I've been getting with it. It was definitely on the costly side, but for me it's been a worth while investment.
customer_reviews.author: Mia

customer_reviews.title: Is Coolpix A the best pocket camera?
customer_reviews.text: Nikon Coolpix A is really smallest camera with large APS-C sensor. Picture quality is very good, but I hoped that will be close to my D90 with fix lens, but ... it isn't. For: - small size, - light weight, - fast ready-to-shoot time, - transparent picture with natural colors, - incredible clear and bright display (D90's display smokes aside), - "i"-button is really hot-key to change anythin on the fly, - good job with smart scenes-mode. Against: - slow autofocus (especially in the night), - no optical stabilization, and as result hard to shoot without camera shake in low-light. Good camera, but these two "against" do not live up to expectations at such a high price.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Hamradio

customer_reviews.title: This camera is great for our outdoor adventures where we don't want to ...
customer_reviews.text: This camera is great for our outdoor adventures where we don't want to take our larger camera. The pictures are high quality and the camera is easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: RoseyNic

customer_reviews.title: so i wouldn't recommend for sport photography
customer_reviews.text: Focus hunts a bit in low light, so i wouldn't recommend for sport photography. It does take very nice low light pictures, even at higher ISO. Macro is not that great but this is normal for a camera with this set-up. The pictures that it takes during the day are fantastic. Well worth the price I paid about 2 years ago, on sale... now it is 3 times that, so I would think twice. I am sure you can get something better for the price now days.
customer_reviews.author: sailorboy414

customer_reviews.title: Little gem!!!
customer_reviews.text: A D7000 with a 18mm f2.8 (28mm FX equivalent) stuffed into a point and shoot body, build with metal... awesome!!! This camera is very light and portable. I slap a Nikon SB-300 (perfect match) on it for family functions, so I can bounce the light. Great for local day trips, functions, etc.. anytime you need to be small and light. Still adore my D800 and heavy glass, but this is awesome for the days when you don't want to lug heavy equipment around. Only handicap is the limited prime lens. But it's sharp! If you're use to primes, you'll love this camera.
customer_reviews.author: Darren W. Brown

customer_reviews.title: ... Nikon D7000 with no AA filter but with the best wide angle prime DX lens Nikon has
customer_reviews.text: This is basically a Nikon D7000 with no AA filter but with the best wide angle prime DX lens Nikon has, BUT shrunk to 1/5 the size and weight. Enough said. I am very happy with it. So much imaging power packed into such a tiny body
customer_reviews.author: NCHammer

customer_reviews.title: Great lightweight backup for a DSLR
customer_reviews.text: Bought this refurbished for $299 as a backup to my Nikon D800E for travel. Very happy so far. It has been performing well in both in regular conditions and low light (similar results as my Nikon D7000, which I can now leave at home). I find it quite easy to use. I haven't tried the Ricoh GR, but from what I have read the differences in image quality between the two cameras are marginal. Given that the Coolpix A can now be had for half the price of the Ricoh -- and $1000 less than when it was originally introduced -- this was a no brainer.
customer_reviews.author: Ken R

customer_reviews.title: very nice
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice point and shoot. Having a fixed lens is no problem for me, it is like freedom not to fiddle with a zoom lever. I found that i almost always shot with the lens at the wide end anyhow. If you want a larger image walk closer or zoom in when you print, the large sensor lets you crop and has plenty of resolution for good results. No VR, no problem. VR only really works with tele lens. you do not need it with a wide angle lens.
customer_reviews.author: MONGO

customer_reviews.title: What is not to love - add a Mega Gear Case
customer_reviews.text: Small, light weight and sharp high quality output. What is not to love when I got it at drastically reduced price point available now. Pair with a Mega Gear leather case from Amazon and you have a set yourself up in high quality style. (Mega Gear cases are also so responsible at Amazon, almost 75% less than the Nikon one.)
customer_reviews.author: Mountain Rose

customer_reviews.title: Dust again
customer_reviews.text: It is a very fine camera - fantastic colors and a lot of microcontrast, but Nikons problem arised again: After 12 days a dust particle ruined more or less the pictures, and I had to send it back, sorry to say. And it was not just in small apertures, also f. 4.and f. 5.6 it showed up, and I was very carefully with it, so it is not that. Now they have done a fine firmware with better AF and closer, but look here at Flickr, Nikon has a real problem, so I am not sure I buy it again:
customer_reviews.author: SK

customer_reviews.title: Great street photo camera
customer_reviews.text: I got the camera in a national chain electronics store, impressed by being lightweight, can put it in my shirt pocket, great dynamic range with good light, get an extra battery if you are trigger happy, I got about 300 plus pics from the battery it went to two bars, not completely depleted.I must say that the iso range is very decent, after the new LR 4.4 appeared, I could get excelent image quality on to iso 3200, from 6400 on is very acceptable, had to edit my opinion given the LR update. I think is a good second camera, or a great street camera.
customer_reviews.author: Evaristo Cedillo Salazar

product_meta.title: Nikon COOLPIX A 16.2 MP Digital Camera with 28mm f/2.8 Lens (Black)
product_meta.description: The black nikon coolpix a digital camera is a point-and-shoot equipped with a 16.2mp dx-format cmos sensor for clear, detailed images--even in low light. The lack of an optical low-pass filter enables maximized resolution for exceptionally sharp details. The nikkor prime lens features a focal length of 18.5mm (35mm equivalent: 28mm) for wide-angle shooting, as well as a fast f/2.8 maximum aperture. Frame shots using the large 3.0-inch lcd monitor, which has a resolution of 921k pixels. Record full hd 1080p video with stereo sound, and connect the supplied eg-cp16 cable for playback on your tv. Capture raw (nef) still images for a higher level of creative control.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.8 out of 5 stars25 ratings3.8 out of 5 stars
